newsitem.title: TAIWAN: ASE Test 2nd-qtr pretax up 100.5 pct.
newsitem.headline: ASE Test 2nd-qtr pretax up 100.5 pct.

text.p: ASE Test Ltd, the first Taiwanese firm directly listed in the U.S. Nasdaq National Market, said on Friday its second-quarter pretax profit surged 100.5 percent to US$9.4 million from a year earlier.
ASE Test, an integrated-circuit testing firm, is 79.6 percent owned by Taiwan's integrated-circuit packaging firm Advanced Semiconductor Engineering Inc.
ASE Test's second-quarter sales rose 52.4 percent to US$43.4 million from a year earlier, and second-quarter net profit surged 71.9 percent to US$10.2 million, it said in a statement.
The company said all figures reported were on a pro-forma consolidated basis to include ASE Test in Taiwan and ASE Malaysia, a unit acquired by ASE Test in April.
It said both sales and profit showed strong growth due to an accelerating trend toward outsourcing in the industry.

"Sales and net income from Malaysia have shown considerable growth, driven by increasing orders from customers across the board," Joseph Tung, the firm's chief financial officer, said in the statement.
ASE Test said that because it consolidated two existing plants into one new facility during May and June, it had experienced "some capacity constraints", Tung said.
Nevertheless, he said, the new facility has three times the space before and can accommodate the firm's growth until 2000.
ASE Test held its initial public offering in June 1996 in Nasdaq.
